page.title: 07AMWELL QUARRY
page.content: {Amwell Quarry }has been worked for twelve years and has nearly 18 months of digging left before all the stone has been worked.All the working is from below water.Large buckets attached to cranes dig out up to 5 tons of stone at a time.This is taken by conveyor to a grading tower where different sized stones are kept to be loaded onto lorries when needed.As all the working is under water the stone does not need to be washed and this makes the cost of working {Amwell {Quarry }slightly less than dry quarries. The company working the quarry has spent a great deal of time restoring the land and turning it into a sanctuary for animals,birds,plants and insects.Eventually they hope to reintroduce otters onto this site.
